title: GZip compression
summary: gzip is a file format used for file compression and decompression. It is based on the Deflate algorithm that allows files to be made smaller in size which allows for faster network transfers. gzip is commonly supported by web servers and modern browsers, meaning that servers can automatically compress files with gzip before sending them, and browsers can uncompress files upon receiving them.
